generalInfo:
Experience the vibrant heartbeat of Buenos Aires in this immersive 5-day adventure, where you’ll traverse the city from south to north. Begin your journey in the lively neighborhoods of La Boca and San Telmo, soaking up the rich history and colorful street art. Indulge in the city's renowned culinary scene with tastings of Argentine delicacies and world-famous steaks, and delve into the soul-stirring rhythms of tango at local milongas. Each day offers a unique glimpse into Buenos Aires’ eclectic culture, culminating in a scenic exploration of the Tigre Delta.

Venture out to the Tigre Delta, where lush waterways and serene landscapes provide a tranquil escape from the city’s bustle. Take a guided kayak tour through this natural wonder, and experience the traditional charm of San Antonio de Areco, where you’ll connect with the gaucho culture and enjoy a classic asado feast. This well-rounded journey captures the essence of Buenos Aires, blending urban excitement with natural beauty and cultural depth.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Argentina! Upon arrival, a private transfer to your hotel. Upon arriving in this fascinating city, you will immerse yourself in a unique atmosphere where architectural elegance blends with contagious energy. Located on the banks of the majestic Río de la Plata, Buenos Aires will seduce you with its cosmopolitan charm and rich cultural history. From magnificent European-style architecture to vibrant neighborhoods full of life, every corner of the city tells a fascinating story and invites you to explore its charms. Discover the passion and rhythm of Buenos Aires as you delve into its bustling streets and experience the warmth of its people. Let yourself be carried away by the tempting aromas of restaurants and cafes, where you can enjoy delicious Argentine cuisine and famous cuts of meat. Immerse yourself in the city's rich nightlife, where music and tango dancing invite you to move to the rhythm of passion and emotion. From the elegant boulevards of Avenida 9 de Julio to the charming corners of San Telmo and La Boca, Buenos Aires awaits you with open arms to offer you an unforgettable experience. At around 6 pm, you’re setting off on a culinary journey through the lively streets of Palermo, discovering the trendiest neighborhood in the city while savoring some of its best dishes. During the tour, you’ll have the chance to taste an exciting variety of local dishes that showcase Argentine flavors, enjoy superb sightseeing, and learn more about life in the dazzling capital. Elevate your experience with our 4-hour Premium Culinary Tour, an exclusive journey through Palermo’s most luxurious dining destinations, including a Michelin Guide-recognized restaurant and a Top 50 Latin America award winner. Our tour begins at an unconventional spot, a "rotisería" or neighborhood grocery. This retro-inspired place offers an appetizing menu and a relaxed atmosphere. Here, you’ll enjoy a vermouth accompanied by some delicious snacks—all local favorites—before heading to our next destination. No culinary tour in Buenos Aires would be complete without wine, so our second stop is a restaurant and wine bar where you’ll taste the famous Argentine malbec, as well as other regional varieties that are less known but equally captivating. Don’t worry, you’ll also have incredible appetizers to accompany the wine tasting. Next, we visit an iconic "bodegón" or diner-style restaurant. This lively local classic is a favorite among residents who don’t hesitate to queue up for an elevated version of hearty classics. However, we can skip the line and head straight to the food, sampling a variety of traditional dishes—and more wine! And finally—though not least—we make our way to a fantastic parrilla a few blocks away, to savor some of that famous Argentine steak—we promise it’s as good as you’ve heard. And to end the evening on a sweet note, we’ll enjoy the quintessential Argentine dessert (no spoilers!). Throughout the tour, you’ll have the chance to admire Palermo’s bold and colorful street art, distinctive low-rise architecture, eclectic shops, and vibrant atmosphere. Our guides know these streets like the back of their hand and are happy to answer any questions you may have. Meals: Dinner included Duration: 4 hours Small group, English/Spanish-speaking guide

Your guide will meet you at your hotel, to show you the historical district (Plaza de Mayo, the Cabildo, and the main buildings), pointing out different architectural styles and impressive domes. After strolling along its Haussmann-style boulevards, head to the bohemian neighborhood of San Telmo and the very colorful La Boca, famous for its unique street, Caminito, a true open-air museum. At some point during your visit, you will enjoy 60 minutes in a comfortable studio with your professional dance teacher in the world capital of tango. During the lesson, you will learn the basic steps (or more if you already dance) to dance tango on the dance floor, the embrace, how to walk, the basic step, the "Ocho," and other movements. The Argentine and Uruguayan tradition of tango, now renowned worldwide, was born in the popular circles of Buenos Aires and Montevideo, in the Rio de la Plata basin. In this region where European immigrants, descendants of African slaves, and natives mix, the Criollos, a heterogeneous mix of customs, beliefs, and rituals, emerged to evolve into a characteristic cultural identity. Among the best-known forms of expression of this identity, the music, dance, and poetry of tango are both a reflection and a vector of cultural diversity and dialogue. English-speaking guide. The visit is done on foot and by public transportation. Duration: 5 hours. At 5 pm, you will begin an Asado Experience. It's a BBQ cooking class with premium meat and wine where you will discover a local authentic Argentine tradition. This activity recreates the Asado in a unique location: Belen's +100 years old family house in Belgrano, a residential neighborhood in Buenos Aires city. The fire is the first step of this ritual. It is much more than cooking, is turning on tradition, memories, and new experiences with friends or family. In fact, the asado is just an excuse to be reunited around the fire sharing a glass of wine and laughter. You will enjoy different cuts of our premium meat selection accompanied by premium wine, Catena Zapata, an Argentinian wine that stands with the best in the world. You will be participating in a hands-on activity where we will prepare the traditional Chimichurri Sauce with Belen’s family recipe. You will be also helping the host with the cooking process: salting the cuts, using our tools to identify in which cooking stage the cuts are, and placing the egg on the red pepper to discover how we cook each ingredient on the grill. You will learn how to start the fire, you will share a table with other guests, you will prepare the chimichurri sauce with Belen's family recipe and you will learn about Argentinian meat and the best techniques to grill. Not only you will be hearing a lot of stories and anecdotes about Argentina from us, but you’ll also get to share a meal with a reduced group of travelers from all over the world. Finally, you will taste unique flavors experiencing the flow of an authentic Argentine Asado. Three-hour 'hands-on' experience. English/Spanish speaking Asadora Meals: Dinner Included Duration: 3 hours Group type: Small group

Enjoy a day in the natural scenery of Buenos Aires. This adventure offers a panoramic view of the aristocratic neighbourhoods of northern Buenos Aires. We will enjoy local customs, get a glimpse of what life used to be like in these places, and cycle along the riverbank. We will dive deep into the Paraná delta and paddle a kayak to an island for a barbecue. This experience was designed with the adventurous in mind; those travellers who dream of getting lost in nature and discovering a new ecosystem; those travellers who are active and enjoy sports; and those who are looking for a fun and authentic outdoor adventure. Total distance: 30 km Physical demand: Intermediate Approximate cycling time: 4 hrs

This excursion is an opportunity for you to discover, in a recreational and cultural way, one of the last villages in Argentina that preserves its customs and traditions, maintaining the gaucho as a symbol of its identity. A private transfer takes you to the countryside near Buenos Aires. You have an hour and a half journey to reach San Antonio de Areco. Your English-speaking guide will accompany you on this day of exploration in the village! You will have the opportunity to discover the picturesque streets of the historic center, the "pulperías" (old gauchos' bars), the renowned Draghi Goldsmith Museum, the traditional workshops of local artisans, among others. Program details: 08:30 | We pick you up in Buenos Aires at the address you provide, and then we take the road to San Antonio de Areco, the birthplace of gaucho traditions. 10:00 | After a warm welcome by your local guide, you set off to discover the old grocery stores and centuries-old bars of San Antonio de Areco, the Saint Anthony of Padua Parish, different local artisans including the Draghi Goldsmith Workshop, and other sites of interest in the village. 12:00 | Still accompanied by your guide, we take you to the Estancia, located a 15-minute drive away in the middle of the Pampas plains. After a brief introduction to the place and a horseback ride (or carriage ride) to explore the 400 hectares of the property, you are invited to enjoy a delicious asado lunch served in the shade of centuries-old trees. You will then have the opportunity to admire an equestrian skill demonstration performed by the gauchos of the Estancia, as well as traditional Argentine music and dances. 16:30 | Departure to Buenos Aires with your driver. Asado lunch: grilled meats accompanied by salads, beverages, dessert, and coffee. Possibility of adapted menus for vegetarians, vegans, celiacs, etc. Swimming pool available in summer. Duration: from 8:30 am to 6:30 pm. Group: 7 people maximum
Depending on the flight schedule, your guide will drive you to Buenos Aires International Airport. End of our services.
